rules.natural: Article X is either approved for publication or meets platform guidelines
If Article X is scheduled for release, then it will not be published immediately
If Article X is held for editing, then it will not be published immediately
Either editor review is completed for Article X or copy editing is required
If copy editing is required for Article X, then it will be held for editing
If disciplinary action is taken regarding Article X, then no procedure violation is reported
If executive approval is granted for Article X, then priority status is assigned
If Article X receives fast track processing, then it meets platform guidelines
If limited distribution is approved for Article X, then it is published with restrictions
If full publication is authorized for Article X, then it meets platform guidelines
If hold is lifted from Article X, then a distribution hold was previously placed
If release decision is made for Article X, then it is either scheduled for release or held for editing
If manual review is required for Article X, then should it be flagged for review, it will not be approved for publication
Either manual review is required for Article X or automated review is triggered
If senior editor is assigned to Article X, then under the condition that automated review triggering does not lead to flagged review preventing approval, content will be approved
Either senior editor is assigned to Article X or junior editor is assigned
If junior editor is assigned to Article X, then whenever automated review triggering does not result in flagged review preventing approval, content will be approved
Should neither copyright verification occur nor the condition that non-guideline compliance leads to plagiarism detection prevent citation check completion, then legal department is notified

Provided that neither copyright verification occurs nor the condition that non-guideline compliance leads to plagiarism detection prevents citation check completion, then legal department is not notified
If standard procedure following does not result in editor review completion leading to scheduled release, then procedure violation is reported
Whenever standard procedure following does not lead to editor review completion resulting in scheduled release, disciplinary action is taken
If priority status assignment does not result in fast track processing, then status review is required
Provided that neither limited distribution approval nor full publication authorization happens, then hold is lifted
Whenever neither limited distribution approval nor full publication authorization occurs, then no distribution hold is placed
If final approval giving does not lead to release decision making, then approval is escalated
Under the condition that final approval giving does not result in release decision making, approval is not escalated
Provided that automated review triggering does not result in flagged review preventing approval, then content is not approved
If non-guideline compliance does not result in plagiarism detection, then citation check is completed
If Article X does not meet platform guidelines, then it is published immediately

(A1 ∨ G).natural: Article X is either approved for publication or meets platform guidelines

(A10 ∨ (¬(¬G → A8) → ¬A9)).natural: If copyright is not verified for Article X, then provided that failure to meet guidelines does not result in plagiarism detection, citation check will not be completed

(A13 → ¬A12).natural: If Article X is scheduled for release, then it will not be published immediately

(A13 ∨ A14).natural: Article X is either scheduled for release or held for editing

(A14 → ¬A12).natural: If Article X is held for editing, then it will not be published immediately

(A15 → A13).natural: If editor review is completed for Article X, then it will be scheduled for release

(A15 ∨ A16).natural: Either editor review is completed for Article X or copy editing is required

(A16 → A14).natural: If copy editing is required for Article X, then it will be held for editing

(A17 → (A15 → A13)).natural: Provided that standard procedure is followed for Article X, then if editor review is completed, Article X will be scheduled for release

(A19 → ¬A18).natural: If disciplinary action is taken regarding Article X, then no procedure violation is reported

(A2 → ¬A1).natural: If Article X is flagged for review, then it is not approved for publication

(A20 → A21).natural: If executive approval is granted for Article X, then it receives fast track processing

(A20 → A22).natural: If executive approval is granted for Article X, then priority status is assigned

(A20 → G).natural: If executive approval is granted for Article X, then it meets platform guidelines

(A21 → G).natural: If Article X receives fast track processing, then it meets platform guidelines

(A22 → A21).natural: If priority status is assigned to Article X, then it receives fast track processing

(A24 ∨ G).natural: Article X is either published with restrictions or meets platform guidelines

(A25 → A24).natural: If limited distribution is approved for Article X, then it is published with restrictions

(A25 ∨ A26).natural: Either limited distribution is approved for Article X or full publication is authorized

(A26 → G).natural: If full publication is authorized for Article X, then it meets platform guidelines

(A28 → A27).natural: If hold is lifted from Article X, then a distribution hold was previously placed

(A29 → (A13 ∨ A14)).natural: If release decision is made for Article X, then it is either scheduled for release or held for editing

(A3 → (A2 → ¬A1)).natural: If manual review is required for Article X, then should it be flagged for review, it will not be approved for publication

(A3 ∨ A4).natural: Either manual review is required for Article X or automated review is triggered

(A30 → A29).natural: If final approval is given for Article X, then a release decision is made

(A4 → (A2 → ¬A1)).natural: If automated review is triggered for Article X, then provided that it is flagged for review, it will not be approved for publication

(A6 → (¬(A4 → (A2 → ¬A1)) → A5)).natural: If senior editor is assigned to Article X, then under the condition that automated review triggering does not lead to flagged review preventing approval, content will be approved

(A6 ∨ A7).natural: Either senior editor is assigned to Article X or junior editor is assigned

(A7 → (¬(A4 → (A2 → ¬A1)) → A5)).natural: If junior editor is assigned to Article X, then whenever automated review triggering does not result in flagged review preventing approval, content will be approved

(¬(A10 ∨ (¬(¬G → A8) → ¬A9)) → A11).natural: Should neither copyright verification occur nor the condition that non-guideline compliance leads to plagiarism detection prevent citation check completion, then legal department is notified

(¬(A10 ∨ (¬(¬G → A8) → ¬A9)) → ¬A11).natural: Provided that neither copyright verification occurs nor the condition that non-guideline compliance leads to plagiarism detection prevents citation check completion, then legal department is not notified

(¬(A17 → (A15 → A13)) → A18).natural: If standard procedure following does not result in editor review completion leading to scheduled release, then procedure violation is reported

(¬(A17 → (A15 → A13)) → A19).natural: Whenever standard procedure following does not lead to editor review completion resulting in scheduled release, disciplinary action is taken

(¬(A17 → (A15 → A13)) → ¬A18).natural: Under the condition that standard procedure following does not cause editor review completion to lead to scheduled release, no procedure violation is reported

(¬(A22 → A21) → A23).natural: If priority status assignment does not result in fast track processing, then status review is required

(¬(A25 ∨ A26) → A27).natural: Should neither limited distribution approval nor full publication authorization occur, then distribution hold is placed

(¬(A25 ∨ A26) → A28).natural: Provided that neither limited distribution approval nor full publication authorization happens, then hold is lifted

(¬(A25 ∨ A26) → ¬A27).natural: Whenever neither limited distribution approval nor full publication authorization occurs, then no distribution hold is placed

(¬(A30 → A29) → A31).natural: If final approval giving does not lead to release decision making, then approval is escalated

(¬(A30 → A29) → ¬A31).natural: Under the condition that final approval giving does not result in release decision making, approval is not escalated

(¬(A4 → (A2 → ¬A1)) → A5).natural: Should automated review triggering not lead to flagged review preventing approval, then content is approved

(¬(A4 → (A2 → ¬A1)) → ¬A5).natural: Provided that automated review triggering does not result in flagged review preventing approval, then content is not approved

(¬(¬G → A8) → A9).natural: If non-guideline compliance does not result in plagiarism detection, then citation check is completed

(¬(¬G → A8) → ¬A9).natural: Whenever non-guideline compliance does not lead to plagiarism detection, then citation check is not completed

(¬G → A12).natural: If Article X does not meet platform guidelines, then it is published immediately

(¬G → A8).natural: If Article X does not meet platform guidelines, then plagiarism is detected
